com.opera.core.systems.scope.stp.services

Class ScopeExec

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.opera.core.systems.scope.AbstractService
      • com.opera.core.systems.scope.stp.services.ScopeExec
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Service, Exec

    public class ScopeExec
extends AbstractService
implements Exec
    The exec service handles user interactions such as key presses, mouse clicks, screenshot grabbing and executing actions on Opera.

      Create one or more mouse actions on coordinates x,y with key(s) as specified in OperaMouseKeys and the number of repeated events as an integer.

      • action

        public void action(String using,
          String... params)
        Description copied from interface: Exec
        Execute an Opera action with parameters.
        Specified by:
        action in interface Exec
        Parameters:
        using - the name of the action to execute
        params - the string parameters for extra string data to be sent with the action, e.g. "opera.com" to the command "go"

      • action

        public void action(String using,
          int windowID,
          String... params)
        Description copied from interface: Exec
        Execute an Opera action with parameters to a specific window. If you specify the wrong window, the action will fail. Specifying window as 0 will send the command to the currently active window.
        Specified by:
        action in interface Exec
        Parameters:
        using - the name of the action to execute
        windowID - window to send the action to, 0 for the currently active window
        params - the string parameters for extra string data to be sent with the action, e.g. "opera.com" to the command "go"

      • action

        public void action(String using,
          int data,
          String dataString,
          String dataStringParam)
        Description copied from interface: Exec
        Execute an Opera action with a data parameter for extra integer data to be sent with the action. In some actions the data parameter is interpreted as a pointer rather than an integer. In these cases the action will fail.
        Specified by:
        action in interface Exec
        Parameters:
        using - the name of the action to execute
        data - data parameter for extra integer data to be sent with the action
        dataString - string parameter for extra string data to be sent with the action, e.g. "opera.com" to the command "go"
        dataStringParam - extra string parameter for action, sent in addition to the value parameter for actions that need two strings

      • key

        public void key(String key,
       boolean up)
        Description copied from interface: Exec
        Create a key event, this event controls if the key has been previously pressed before allowing key up.
        Specified by:
        key in interface Exec
        up - down if false
